instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground PPBUS
threads.message:
Good morning, this mac is shorted on the PPBUS, we applied voltage to identify the component and identified that the <CHIP>U7410</CHIP> was causing the short. I replaced it, PPBUS now with 13V, however, there is no activity on the USB and it won't turn on.
    Imagine that the CPU died, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground PPBUS
threads.message: Yea 13v went to the CPU from the shorted <CHIP>U7410</CHIP>, so the CPU is dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground PPBUS
threads.message:
Small chance that CPU was still good.
If you injected voltage into <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, you've also injected directly into CPU core.
I cannot imagine someone still does this, after so many times explained on the forum how NOT to do that.
You MUST first check if any high-side MOSFET is shorted, or not.

90% of cases, CPU is dead after high-side MOSFET found shorted in CPU power supply.
But if you inject voltage over shorted one, then 100% CPU got dead!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground PPBUS
threads.message: So how should I identify a short in the MOSFET without applying a voltage to the PPBUS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground PPBUS
threads.message:
READING the forum...
"so many times explained on the forum"
